name: France Gall
description: '''Isabelle Geneviève Marie Anne Gall''' (9 October 1947 – 7 January 2018), known professionally as '''France Gall''' ({{IPA|fr|fʁãs gal|lang|LL-Q150 (fra)-Exilexi-France Gall.wav}}), was a French ''[[yé-yé]]'' and pop singer. In 1965, at the age of 17, she won the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1965|tenth edition]] of the [[Eurovision Song Contest]] with the song "{{Lang|fr|[[Poupée de cire, poupée de son]]|italics=no}}", representing [[Luxembourg in the Eurovision Song Contest 1965|Luxembourg]]. Later in her career, she  worked with singer-songwriter [[Michel Berger]], whom she married in 1976. Her most successful singles include "{{Lang|fr|[[Il jouait du piano debout]]|italics=no}}", "{{Lang|fr|[[Ella, elle l'a]]|italics=no}}" and "{{Lang|fr|[[Évidemment (France Gall song)|Évidemment]]|italics=no}}".
